title: 105_s2582
content: The Act titled "Medicare Psychiatric Hospital Prospective Payment System Act of 1998" establishes a Medicare prospective payment system for psychiatric facilities. The Medicare Psychiatric Hospital Prospective Payment System Act of 1998 establishes a prospective payment system for inpatient psychiatric services under the Social Security Act. This system determines the amount of payment for operating and capital-related costs of psychiatric facilities during a transition period from October 1, 2000, to October 1, 2003. The Medicare Psychiatric Hospital Prospective Payment System Act of 1998 sets payment amounts for psychiatric facilities based on TEFRA and PPS percentages of per diem rates. This applies to inpatient hospital services from October 1, 2003, onwards. The Medicare Psychiatric Hospital Prospective Payment System Act of 1998 establishes payment rates for psychiatric facilities based on per diem rates. Payment for new facilities without a base fiscal year is determined by the applicable Federal per diem rate. The Secretary determines facility-specific per diem rates for allowable operating and capital-related costs. The Secretary determines per diem rates for allowable operating and capital-related costs of inpatient hospital services for psychiatric facilities. The rates are updated by a market basket percentage increase for each cost reporting period. The Secretary determines per diem rates for allowable operating and capital-related costs of inpatient hospital services for psychiatric facilities. The rates are updated by a market basket percentage increase for each cost reporting period, with adjustments made for variations among facilities in average facility wage. The Secretary determines per diem rates for psychiatric facilities based on average facility wage levels and case mix adjustments. Separate rates are computed for urban and rural areas. The Secretary computes separate per diem rates for psychiatric facilities in urban and rural areas based on average facility wage levels and case mix adjustments. Weighted average rates are calculated for psychiatric hospitals and units in specified areas. The Secretary establishes separate average per diem rates for facilities owned by government agencies and for other facilities. Weighted averages are computed based on the number of days of inpatient hospital services provided. The Secretary computes Federal per diem rates for psychiatric facilities each fiscal year based on weighted averages, adjusted for market basket percentage increase. The Secretary adjusts Federal per diem rates for psychiatric facilities based on variations in facility wage levels, case mix, and proportion of low-income patients served. Additionally, adjustments may be made for outlier cases. The Secretary may adjust for outlier cases, indirect costs of medical education, and other factors deemed appropriate. Budget neutrality must be maintained in implementing adjustments to prevent aggregate payment changes. The Secretary will establish classes of patients for psychiatric facilities. The Secretary will establish classes of patients in psychiatric facilities based on factors determined to be appropriate, and assign weighting factors to reflect resource usage. Data collection and utilization monitoring may be required. The Secretary may require psychiatric facilities to submit necessary data for system implementation. Monitoring utilization changes and reporting to Congress with recommendations for addressing unwarranted changes. Special adjustments for reducing aggregate payment amounts. The Secretary may require psychiatric facilities to submit data for system implementation and monitor utilization changes. Special adjustments are made to reduce aggregate payment amounts for inpatient hospital services furnished by psychiatric facilities during specific fiscal years. The Secretary may require psychiatric facilities to submit data for system implementation and monitor utilization changes. Special adjustments are made to reduce aggregate payment amounts for inpatient hospital services furnished by psychiatric facilities during specific fiscal years. The percentage increase under paragraphs (2)(B) and (3)(E) in this subsection replaces certain provisions of subsection (b)(3)(B)(ii). Reductions under this paragraph do not impact the amounts payable for cost reporting periods starting after fiscal year 2002. Definitions for this subsection include 'base fiscal year' and 'PPS percentage'. The term 'psychiatric facility' refers to a psychiatric hospital or unit. The 'TEFRA percentage' is defined based on cost reporting periods. The TEFRA percentage for cost reporting periods varies from 75 percent to 25 percent between 2000 and 2003. A limit on reductions under the Balanced Budget Act is specified for psychiatric facilities. For psychiatric facilities, the payment for inpatient hospital services' operating costs must meet certain percentages for specific cost reporting periods between 1997 and 1999. The percentages range from 95% to 90% during this time frame. The amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) shall apply as if included in the enactment of the Balanced Budget Act of 1997, defining the term 'psychiatric facility' as a psychiatric hospital or unit.
